question:
Aristotle was one of the firsts to attempt to codify "thinking".
His _________ provided patterns of argument structure that always gave correct conclusions, given correct premises
Turing test or Imitation Game, was put forth as a simple test that could be used to _______

Overall computational cost of a AI Production System is in two major categories:
Rule Application Cost and Control Strategy Cost.
For an Uninformed Control System, we have the following:

options.option: Low Rule Application Cost and High Control Strategy Cost
Low Rule Application Cost and Low Control Strategy Cost
High Rule Application Cost and Low Control Strategy Cost
High Rule Application Cost and High Control Strategy Cost

question:
For more complex games, such as chess or checker the AND/OR search to termination is out of question.
Which of the following statements are true?
I. Our goal in searching such a game tree might be, instead, merely to find a good first move.
II. Extract from the search graph an estimate of the ‘best’ first move.

options.option: Both I and II are false.

question: For Breadth First Search, the following statements are correct

options.option: Nodes are added to the front of the OPEN list.

question:
Bidirectional search is a graph search algorithm that runs two simultaneous searches.
Which of the following statements is false for bidirectional search?

options.option: Requires the ability to generate predecessor states.
Works well only when there are unique start and goal states

question:
There are two distinct specialized production systems;
Order in which a set of applicable rules is applied to a database is unimportant for a ________ production system.
To solve a problem using a production system, one must specify __________________

options.option: The Global database, Rules and Control Strategy

question: __________ aims at building machines that act intelligently, without taking a position on whether or not the machines actually are intelligent.
The AO* algorithm can best be seen as the following TWO major operations:

options.option: Step I: Top-down: graph-growing; Step II: Bottom-up: cost-revising, SOLVE-labelling.
Step I: Bottom-up: graph-growing; Step II: Top-down: cost-revising, SOLVE-labelling.
Step I: Top-down: graph-growing, SOLVE-labelling; Step II: Bottom-up: cost-revising.
Step I: Bottom-up: graph-growing, SOLVE-labelling; Step II: Top-down: cost-revising.

question: The A* search algorithm is based on ___________

A* generates an optimal solution under which of the following conditions?
Condition 1: If h(n) is an admissible heuristic and the search space is a tree.
Condition 2: If h(n) is a consistent heuristic and the search space is a graph.

options.option: A* never generate an optimal solution.

question: Which of the following statements are true for inadmissible heuristics?

options.option: Breaks optimality by trapping good plans on the fringe.
Slow down search by assigning a lower cost to a bad plan.

question:
A solution to a CSP is a complete assignment that satisfies all the constraints.
Which of the two are true for a solution to a CSP?
I. An assignment that does not violate any constraints is called consistent or legal.
II. A complete assignment is one in which every variable is mentioned.

Arc Consistency is a method of constraint propagation.
Which of the following statements are correct for arc consistency?

options.option: Arc consistency is substantially stronger than forward checking.
Arc consistency is one of the most powerful propagation techniques for binary constraints.
Provides a fast method of constraint propagation.

question:
____________ is a backtracking algorithm for CSP that is aware of the underlying constraint graph;
determines where to jump back to, based on the actual conflict that it has recorded.

For solutions in an AND-OR graph,
which of the following statements are true.

options.option: Need an algorithm similar to best-first search; but with the ability to handle the AND arc appropriately.
AO* algorithm use a single structure - a graph - representing part of the search graph.
At least one arm of an AND arc must lead to a solution node.
A solution graph of an AND-OR graph is analogous to a path in an ordinary graph.

question:
Alpha-beta pruning had been reinvented a number of times!
The earliest version was by _______________ for a checkers simulation.

Give one word or a phrase for:
A mathematical representation of a situation in which each participant's gain or loss of utility is exactly balanced by the losses or gains of utility of the other participants.
Solving a constraint satisfaction problem on a finite domain is an/a ___________ problem with respect to the domain size.

____________ is a backtracking algorithm for CSP that is aware of the underlying constraint graph;
determines where to jump back to, based on the actual conflict that it has recorded.
Applying alpha-beta pruning as appropriate, cut-off search below node D is __________.
Applying alpha-beta pruning as appropriate, cut-off search below node B is ___________.
Identity the correct combination of terms and definitions

A knowledge representation is fundamentally a ___________;
a substitute for the thing itself used to enable an entity to determine consequences by reasoning about the world.

A physical symbol system has the necessary and sufficient means for general intelligent action.
Identify the correct statements with regards to Symbol System Hypothesis

options.option: Knowledge may be represented as symbol structures.
Represents a computational system inspired by the human brain.
Intelligent behaviour can be achieved through manipulation of symbol structures.
Human reasoning is a kind of symbol manipulation.

question:
A proposition in a KR language does not mean anything on its own.
The _________ (i.e. the meaning) of the proposition must be defined by the language author through _________.
Identify the statements that are true for propositional logic.

options.option: Can directly talk about properties of individuals or relations between individuals.
Generalizations, patterns, regularities can’t easily be represented.
A propositional variable represents an arbitrary proposition.

question:
Consider which of the following statements are correct w.r.t. entailment in first-order logic being semi-decidable.
I. Algorithms exist that say yes to every entailed sentence
II. No algorithm exists that says no to every non-entailed sentence

If a sentence has no free variables, it is called a _________ sentence;
If it has neither free nor bound variables, it is called a __________ sentence.

Consider the statement ¬(P ∪ Q)≡(¬P Ո ¬Q).
Identify which of the following are correct.

options.option: Formulas ¬(P ∪ Q) and (¬P Ո ¬Q) have the same truth tables.
The statement is a propositional formula which evaluates to a truth value.
The statement means `the two formulas are equivalent.

question:
Let p, q, r, s represents the following propositions.
p: x ∈ {8, 9, 10, 11, 12}
q: x is a composite number
r: x is a perfect square
s: x is a prime number
The integer x ≥2 which satisfies ¬ ((p → q) ∧ (¬r ∨ ¬s))

Predicate F(x, y, t) is used to represent the statement:
Person x can fool person y at time t.
Select the statement below which expresses best the meaning of the formula ∀x ∃y ∃t (¬F(x, y, t))

options.option: Everyone can fool some person at some time.
No one can fool everyone all the time.
Everyone cannot fool some person all the time.
No one can fool some person at some time.

question:
Intelligent behaviour depends on knowledge.
Formalization of knowledge in a declarative form begins with a ______________.
A conceptualization is a triple consisting of the following

options.option: a set of mappings from terms to objects.
a functional basis set for that universe of discourse.

question: A sentence in a formal language is true if and only if it accurately describes the world according to our conceptualization. ___________ is a mapping between elements of the language and elements of a conceptualization.
Which of the following statements are true w.r.t an interpretation?

options.option: Used to name a specific element of a universe of discourse.
Used as a mapping from terms to objects.
Used to designate a function on members of the universe of discourse.
Used to name a relation on the universe of discourse.

question:
P, Q and R are logical propositions. Identify the statements as tautology, and / or contradiction?
I. ((P∨Q)∧R)↔((P∧R)∨(Q∧R))
II. (P↔Q)∧(Q↔R)∧¬(P↔R)

In existential instantiation, the variable is replaced by a brand-new constant not occurring in this or any other sentence in the KB.
The constant so introduced is called a ________ constant.

Consider which of the following statements are correct w.r.t. satisfiability of logical sentences based on the logical operators involved.
I. Universally quantified sentence is satisfied if and only if the enclosed statement is satisfied for all assignments of the quantified variable.
II. Existentially quantified sentence is satisfied if and only if the enclosed statement is satisfied for few assignments of the quantified variable.
An interpretation of a set of FOL sentences, such that every sentence is true, is a ________.

For the following pair of atomic sentences, give the most general unifier, if it exists:
i. Older(Father(y), y)
ii. Older(Father(x), John)

To unify Knows(John, x) with Knows(y, z) we can have unifiers θ1 = { y/John, x/z } or θ2= { y/John, x/John, z/John}.
Which of the following statements are correct?
I. The first unifier θ1 is more general than the second θ2.
II. There is a single most general unifier (MGU); MGU = {y/John, x/z}.

If Φ logically follows from Δ the set __________ is unsatisfiable.
Applying resolution repeatedly to a set of unsatisfiable clauses, eventually produces the empty clause.

Answer extraction involves converting a refutation tree to a proof tree with statement at the root that can be used as an answer.
Which of the following are true w.r.t the above process of answer extraction?
I. Convert every clause arising from the negation of the goal well-formed formula into a tautology.
II. The statement at the root of the Modified Proof Tree logically follows from the axioms and the tautologies.

Under which of the following conditions, a clause {Li} subsumes a clause {Mi}, if there exists a substitution 's'?
Condition 1: {Li}s is a subset of {Mi}
Condition 2: {Mi}s is a subset of {Li}

options.option: No clause ever subsumes another clause.

question: In ______________________ strategy of resolution refutation, each resolvent has a parent that is either in the base set or that is an ancestor of the other parent.
In first-order logic, each variable refers to some object in a set called the _________.
Give the FOL statement for the following. One's husband is one's male spouse.
additional:
Consider the following representation in First Order Logic using the predicates listed below:
Rohan is a male.
One’s husband is one’s male spouse.
Rohan is Reena’s spouse.
Rohan owns a house.
Every house owner is a home-builder.

Male(x) x is a male
Female(x) x is a female
Husband(x,y) x is the husband of y
Spouse(x,y) x is the spouse of y
House (x) x is a house
Owns (x,y) x owns y
Home-builder(x) x is a home-builder

question: Given the above facts and predicates, state the axiom required to infer the fact: Female(Reena).
additional:
Consider the following representation in First Order Logic using the predicates listed below:
Rohan is a male.
One’s husband is one’s male spouse.
Rohan is Reena’s spouse.
Rohan owns a house.
Every house owner is a home-builder.

Male(x) x is a male
Female(x) x is a female
Husband(x,y) x is the husband of y
Spouse(x,y) x is the spouse of y
House (x) x is a house
Owns (x,y) x owns y
Home-builder(x) x is a home-builder

question: Translate the following English sentence to FOL. Rohan owns a house.
additional:
Consider the following representation in First Order Logic using the predicates listed below:
Rohan is a male.
One’s husband is one’s male spouse.
Rohan is Reena’s spouse.
Rohan owns a house.
Every house owner is a home-builder.

Male(x) x is a male
Female(x) x is a female
Husband(x,y) x is the husband of y
Spouse(x,y) x is the spouse of y
House (x) x is a house
Owns (x,y) x owns y
Home-builder(x) x is a home-builder

question: Translate the following English sentence to FOL. Every house owner is a home-builder.
additional:
Consider the following representation in First Order Logic using the predicates listed below:
Rohan is a male.
One’s husband is one’s male spouse.
Rohan is Reena’s spouse.
Rohan owns a house.
Every house owner is a home-builder.

Male(x) x is a male
Female(x) x is a female
Husband(x,y) x is the husband of y
Spouse(x,y) x is the spouse of y
House (x) x is a house
Owns (x,y) x owns y
Home-builder(x) x is a home-builder

question:
Given the above facts and predicates, with the help of an answer extraction tree state;
Who is a home-builder?
Add suitable axioms required (if any).
additional:
Consider the following representation in First Order Logic using the predicates listed below:
Rohan is a male.
One’s husband is one’s male spouse.
Rohan is Reena’s spouse.
Rohan owns a house.
Every house owner is a home-builder.

Male(x) x is a male
Female(x) x is a female
Husband(x,y) x is the husband of y
Spouse(x,y) x is the spouse of y
House (x) x is a house
Owns (x,y) x owns y
Home-builder(x) x is a home-builder

question: Probability provides a way of summarizing the ___________ that comes from our laziness and ignorance.
Bayes rule can be used to ________ conditioned on one piece of evidence.
__________ provides ways and means of weighing up the desirability of goals and the likelihood of achieving them.

Modelling with Bayesian Networks require an assumption:
There are no direct dependencies in the system being modelled which are not already explicitly shown via arcs.
This is referred to as the ___________.

Which of the following statements are true for a rational agent that maximizes utility while taking a decision?
I. A rational agent should choose the action that maximizes the agent’s expected utility
II. Maximizing expected utility (MEU) is a normative criterion for rational choices of actions.
A and B are conditionally dependent if C or any of its descendants i.e., D or E, have received
E is conditionally independent of A, B and D if C is not instantiated.
D and E are conditionally dependent if C is not instantiated.
Compute P(¬A, B, ¬C, D)
Compute P(A | B, C, D)

Planning algorithms use descriptions in some formal language, usually first-order logic or a subset thereof.
The first key idea behind planning is to "open up " the representation of

Situation calculus is a dialect of First Order Logic.
Which of the following statements hold for situation calculus?

options.option: Situations and actions are explicitly taken to be objects in the domain.
Only way to represent beliefs about a changing world.
Successor-state axiom specifies truth value of fluent in the next state as a function of the action and truth value in the current state.

question:
STRIPS is an alternative representation to the pure situation calculus for planning.
I. Actions are not represented explicitly as part of the world model.
II. Actions are effectively instantaneous.
III. Actions are thought of as operators that syntactically transform world models.
Which of the above statements are correct?

STRIPS make use of a stack that contains both sub-goals and actions that have been proposed to satisfy those sub-goals.
The reasoning strategy used by STRIPS is ______________

ABSTRIPS greatly reduces search space, and is more efficient at solving large problems. I
t is a kind of _____________ planner.

Backward state-space search will find the solution from the goal to action;
it is also called _________.

Representing all that stays unchanged, needs to be accomplished in addition to describing what changes when an action is applied.
One must find an efficient solution for stating what doesn't change.
This dilemma is referred to as the ____________.

During the construction of the planning graph, information about the conflict between operators and literals within a layer is maintained.
I. A conflict is called a mutex condition, which means that a pair of literal or pair of operators is mutually exclusive.
II. For such a pair, both cannot be chosen simultaneously without leading to some kind of conflict. Which of the above statements are correct?

Progression and regression planning are totally ordered plan search forms.
They cannot take advantage of ___________.

GraphPlan is a two-phase algorithm:
Planning Graph Construction followed by Solution Extraction.
Which of the following does the first stage achieve?

options.option: Check if a solution can be extracted.
Some kind of reachability analysis on the given problem.
The graph is treated as a constraint satisfaction problem.

question:
STRIPS is an alternative representation to the pure situation calculus for planning.
Real world domains are complex and don’t satisfy the assumptions of STRIPS.
Which of the following statements are correct for STRIPS?

options.option: Hierarchical Plans cannot be expressed in STRIPS.
STRIPS assumes that all actions occur instantaneously.
Constraints on resources can be handled efficiently in STRIPS.

question:
In real-world domains, agents have to deal with both incomplete and incorrect information.
Which of the following statements are TRUE with regards to incomplete and incorrect information.
I. Incompleteness arises because the world is inaccessible.
II. Incompleteness arises because the world does not necessarily match the agent's model of it.

Hierarchical decomposition or Hierarchical Task Network (HTN) planning, allows non-primitive operators to be included in plans.
Which of the following statements are true?

options.option: Hierarchical planning allows very complex plans to be built up.
Primitive operators represent actions that cannot appear in the final plan.
It is possible to replace a non-primitive operator with its decomposition.
HTN uses abstract operators to incrementally decompose a planning problem.

question:
Sequential decision problems, which include utilities, uncertainty, and sensing, generalize the search and planning problems.
Transition model refers to the following:

options.option: set of probabilities associated with the possible transitions between states after any given action.
a complete mapping from states to actions.
function be specified for the agent in order to determine the value of an action.
specification of the outcome probabilities for each action in each possible state.

question:
Policy Iteration is an alternate algorithm for computing an optimal policy.
The basic idea includes

options.option: Computing the utility of each state.
Use state utilities to select an optimal action in each state.
Calculate a new Maximum Expected Utility policy based on computed utilities.
Start with a random policy and calculate utilities based on if that policy were executed.

question:
For a sequential decision problem, the search algorithm looking for a sequence of actions that leads to a good state, return not the fixed sequence of actions;
rather a policy, which refers to

options.option: a set of situation-action rules for each state.
utility function based on a sequence of states.

question:
Sensor model in a belief network is the conditional probability table associated with the percept node;
and show how reliable they are as sensors.
Which of the following statements are correct for a sensor model?

options.option: If the sensor gives a perfect report of the state, then the sensor model (the CPT) will be purely deterministic.
If the sensor gives a perfect report of the state, then the sensor model (the CPT) will be purely probabilistic.
In order for the system to handle sensor failure, the sensor model must include the possibility of failure; sensor failure in turn affects the sensor's accuracy.
Sensor model describes how the environment generates the sensor data.

question: _______ provides ways and means of weighing up the desirability of goals and the likelihood of achieving them.
________________ provide a general, concise representation for large POMDP, so they can be used as inputs for any POMDP algorithm including value and policy iteration methods.
Partially Observable Markov Decision Problems, or POMDP are characterized by the following conditions:

options.option: Percept does not provide enough information to determine the state or the associated transition probabilities.
The Markov property does not hold for percepts (as opposed to states).
Calculating an optimal policy in an accessible, stochastic environment with a known transition model.
Include the value of information as one component of the decision problem.

question: Who is recognized for coining the term Machine Learning?

Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning are often used interchangeably.
Identify the correct statements with regards to Machine Learning.

options.option: Artificial Intelligence is a subset of Machine Learning.
Machine Learning is a subset of Artificial Intelligence.
Machine Learning is concerned with creating a General Problem Solver.
Machine learning is concerned with building computer programs that improve performance with experience.

question:
Which of the following statements are correct for Machine Learning vis-à-vis Statistics?
I. Machine learning deals with Low-dimensional data [e.g. less than 100 D].
II. Huge amount of structure in the data; methods involve figuring out a way to represent this structure.

Clustering is a technique for finding similarity groups in data, called clusters.
Identify the correct statements vis-à-vis clustering.
I. Clustering is an unsupervised learning task.
II. In clustering problems, class labels are not specified; only the feature vectors representing different objects/instances/ records or situations are known.
III. A cluster is a collection of data items which are “similar” between them, and “dissimilar” to data items in other clusters.

Consider the following statements about regression;
Which of them are true?
I. It relates inputs to outputs.
II. It is used for prediction.
III. It may be used for interpretation.

In a learning agent, the __________ informs the learning element about the performance of the action.
It must use a fixed standard of performance.
Which of the following statements true for Decision Tree as performance element?

options.option: Decision Tree does not take objects or situations into account.
Decision Trees have good correspondence to human decision making

question:
To implement Choose-Attribute in the Decision Tree Learning algorithm, we need a formal measure of “fairly good” and “really useless”.
_____________ provides a mathematical basis for measuring the information content.

Information content is the average information per message.
Information content is also called _________________________.
Decision Tree Learning is one of the most widely used techniques for _______________.

_____________ learning exemplifies the function approximation problem;
where the goal is to produce a prediction y* in response to a query x*;
generally, form their predictions via a learned mapping, which produces an output for each input.

Clustering is hard to evaluate, but very useful in practice.
Cluster evaluation can be done using the following:

options.option: Labelled data as ground truth for cluster evaluation through classification.

question: Why is clustering often called an unsupervised learning task?

options.option: It groups data instances that are similar to (near) each other.
Partitioning is the most simple and basic version of cluster analysis.
No class values denoting an a priori grouping of the data instances are given.
Only the feature vectors representing different objects/instances/ records or situations are known.

question: Intra-cluster cohesion measures how near the data points in a cluster are to the cluster centroid and is a reflection of ____________.

Regression finds relation between variables where changes in some variables may “explain” or possibly “cause” changes in other variables.
Identify the correct statements with regards to dependent and independent variables for a regression problem.

options.option: A variable whose value change when there is any manipulation in the values of independent variable is a dependent variable.
A variable whose value change by the effect of other variables is an independent variable.
Explanatory variables are termed the independent variables.
The variables to be explained are termed the dependent variables.

question:
Which of the following statements are correct for a Maximum Margin Classifier?
I. Best hyperplane is the one that represents the largest separation, or margin, between the two classes.
II. The linear classifier defined by the maximum-margin hyperplane is known as a maximum-margin classifier.

Exclusive reliance on dot products enables approach to solve non-linear problems in a support vector machine because of the following
I. Learning depends only on dot products of sample pairs.
II. Classification depends only on dot products of unknown with samples.
In SVM classification, examples closest to the hyperplane separating the positive from the negative samples are referred to as the _________________________.
Hierarchical algorithms find successive clusters using previously established clusters. ________________ begin with each element as a separate cluster and merge them into successively larger cluster.

Exclusive reliance on dot products enables approach to solve non-linear problems in a support vector machine because of the following
I. Learning depends only on dot products of sample pairs.
II. Classification depends only on dot products of unknown with samples.

A Reinforcement Learning (RL) agent interacting in an environment may include one or more of the following components:
Policy, Value function and Model.
Identify the correct statements in the context of a RL agent?

options.option: A policy is the agent’s behaviour and is a map from state to action.
A model is the agent’s representation of the environment; predicts what it will do next.
The environment need not be observable
Value function is a prediction of the next state.

question: A computational model of a single neuron that can only represent linearly separable functions is the __________.
A perceptron is a ______________

Rosenblatt and others described multilayer feed-forward networks in the late 1950s, but concentrated their research on single-layer perceptron.
This was because of the following reasons:

options.option: Difficulty of finding a sensible way to update the weights between the inputs and the hidden units.
The back-propagation learning algorithm cannot be used.
Learning in complex networks with more than one layer is much more complicated.
Perceptrons can learn from examples through a simple learning rule.

question:
Learning in a multi-layer network proceeds the same way as for perceptron;
Identify which of the following statements are true for the back-propagation algorithm?

options.option: Essentially performs gradient-descent search on the error surface.
Finds a mapping from state/action pairs to values.
one of the simplest and most general methods used for supervised training of multilayered networks.
Assigns blame to individual units in the respective layers.

question:
The layers involved in any CNN model are the convolution layers and the subsampling / pooling layers which allow the network learn filters that are specific to specific parts in an image.
Which of the following are true?
I. The convolution layers help the network retain the spatial arrangement of pixels that is present in any image.
II. The pooling layers allow the network to summarize the pixel information.

Within Deep Neural Networks, _________________________ is a three-layer neural network that tries to reconstruct its input in its output layer.
The output layer contains the same number of units as the input layer.

A Recurrent Neural Network (RNN) can be thought of as multiple copies of the same network;
each network passing a message to a successor.
Which of the following are true for a RNN?
I. RNNs are form of feed-forward networks spanning adjacent time steps.
II. A loop allows information to be passed from one step of the network to the next.

In _______________ each unit is linked only to units in the next layer;
there are no links between units in the same layer,
no links backward to a previous layer,
and no links that skip a layer.

A key difference between traditional Machine Learning (ML) and Deep Learning (DL) is in how features are extracted. Which of the following statements are true?
I. Traditional ML approaches use handcrafted engineering features by applying several feature extraction algorithms, and then apply the learning algorithms.
II. In the case of DL, features are learned automatically and represented hierarchically in multiple levels.
